pr_title: HIVE-24428: Concurrent add_partitions requests may lead to data loss

timeline.message: port patch from the ancient one
add to erxisting case instead new testcases
dont acquire in case already owns

timeline.bodyText: Would it be better to create enum instead of string literals?
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText:
yes...in that case I would prefer to have the enum inside HiveConf - which is not how the HiveConf was designed...because that's not possible I resorted to string literals...
I don't have a good idea how to do this in a bulletproof way...
...or should I just declare an enum in this class - and parse the enum value into it and use that?
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think, having enum in MoveTask should be ok.  Btw, should we allow to modify HIVE_LOCK_FILE_MOVE_MODE in runtime, if not, we can init this enum in constructor or so.
replies.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText: the MoveTask is created in the TaskFactory - and the "work" is only set via setWork - I choose not to override that method and parsed the enum value right when its needed
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: I think, it would be more cleaner to have 0 and 1 argument constructors. Based on current usages of  LocalTableLock constructor you know for sure if lock if null or not.
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

timeline.bodyText: Favor static member classes over non static
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText: its non-static because it needs access to the txnmanager.
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: should we lower log level to debug here to avoid extensive logging.
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

timeline.bodyText: should we lower log level to debug here to avoid extensive logging
timeline.author: deniskuzZ
deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText:
I kept it lowercase to align with the set values of the hiveconf.
replaced it with uppercase ones
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.author: deniskuzZ

timeline.bodyText: could you please remove unneeded nesting here
timeline.author: deniskuzZ
deniskuzZ

timeline.bodyText: I assume we don't have enum for this.
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText: no there isn't any - HiveLockObject has 5 string fields
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText:
minor: i would prefer stream api here, but you can ignore it..
if (locks.stream().filter().anyMatch()){..}
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText:
I tried to use stream api a few times - and I'm a bit against it because:

it's somewhat unreadable
it's harder to read them when they eventually changed in a patch
not really debug friendly
they seem to fit "easy tasks" nicely; but if someone extends it later - it might become a really hard to read expression...

instead of 2 complex lines; this is 7 simple - I would rather keep it
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.author: deniskuzZ
deniskuzZ

timeline.bodyText: i think, it doesn't have to be static
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText:
this field must be static - if it's not; then it could not impose exclusiveness.
note that this field is initialized alongside with the threadPool field
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText:
oh, sorry, i missed that synchronization is done on class level not instance.
Note: there is a bug in synchronization, double checked locking should be used here or if check (threadPool == null) should be moved inside the critical section.
replies.author: deniskuzZ

timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText: yeah..someone should teach that trick to my save-action :D
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: could we call unlock here, before even propagation?
timeline.author: deniskuzZ

replies.bodyText: these locks will only engage in case the same table is touched; I think its safer to also keep this inside the lock
replies.author: kgyrtkirk
